intro: Brassica fruticulosa f. christobalii, commonly known as the Christobalii ornamental mustard, is a compact, bushy plant characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and ornamental plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or as a bedding plant. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant yellow blooms and compact growth habit.
